About me

I am a staff scientist at High Performance Computing group of Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL), Richland, WA. My current research emphasizes on optimizing tensor algorithms such as tensor decompositions and fundamental tensor operations especially for sparse data by utilizing various parallel architectures.


I have recieved my Ph.D. degree in Computational Science & Engineering at Georgia Institute of Technology, advised by Professor Richard Vuduc. Before, I was a research intern of IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center and Intel Parallel Computing Lab in the summers of 2016 and 2015 respectively.


In the past, I have received a Ph.D. degree from Institute of Computing Technology at Chinese Academy of Sciences. My research was about auto-tuning method and optimization for irregular algorithms, including sparse matrix vector multiplication, algebriac multi-grid, and dynamic programming on parallel architectures. I received my B.S. in Information and Computing Science from Dalian University of Technology.

For more information, please click here for the Curriculum Vitae

.

    A Parallel Sparse Tensor Algorithm Benchmark Suite

    A Parallel Tensor Infrastructure for Data Analysis

  • AdaTM

    Adaptive Tensor Memoization algorithm for CP decomposition

  • InTensLi

    Input-adaptive and in-place dense tensor-times-matrix multiply

Research

Current Projects

  • Parallel Tensor Infrastructure (ParTI) on multicore CPUs and GPUs

    Code released in Github: [ParTI]

  • Distributed Sparse CP Decomposition Algorithms

  • CP Decomposition and Matriced Tensor Times Khatri-Rao Product (MTTKRP)

    Improving MTTKRP performance for CP decomposition, and trying to find sparse tensor features to develop a new data structure for sparse tensors.

  • Tucker decomposition and Tensor-Times-Matrix Product (TTM)

    Improved TTM performance by optimizing the data transformation time.

  • Sparse Tensor Collection

    Collect sparse tensors from real-world applications and analyze the sparse tensor behavior, collaborating with Shaden Smith el al. in FROSTT project.

Past Projects

  • SMAT (SpMV Auto-tuner)

  • DGEMM on GPU [Click here for details]

  • Algebraic Multi-grid (AMG)
